About.title: About Quran Corpus Visualizer
About.description: An interactive exploration of the Quran through advanced linguistic visualization. This project aims to make the intricate morphological structure of the Quran accessible and engaging for everyone.

Help.title: Surah Distribution Graph
Help.description: Compares surahs by token volume in one view.
Help.yAxisText: Higher position means more tokens in that surah.
Help.xAxisText: Surahs are ordered by Mushaf sequence (1 to 114).
Help.highlightsText: Highlighted nodes contain the currently selected root or lemma.

ArcFlow.title: Arc Flow Diagram
ArcFlow.modeDescription: Drag to pan. Scroll wheel or +/- to zoom.
ArcFlow.noSelection: No linked selection yet. Pick a surah, ayah, root, or lemma.
ArcFlow.rootLegend: Bar length = frequency; color separates roots.
ArcFlow.posLegend: Bar length = frequency; color identifies POS.
ArcFlow.linksRoot: Links connect roots that share lemmas
ArcFlow.linksAyah: Links connect ayahs through selected-context transitions
ArcFlow.posMapping: POS keys: N noun, V verb, ADJ adjective, PRON pronoun, P preposition, PART particle, CONJ conjunction.
ArcFlow.searchRootHint: {count} roots in the current scope. Type to find and pin a root.
ArcFlow.noRootFound: No matching root found in the current scope.

Help.title: Arc Flow Diagram
Help.description: A ranked overview of frequent roots, POS tags, or ayahs in the current scope.
Help.rootText: Each bar is a root. Longer bars mean higher frequency. Curves connect roots that share lemmas.
Help.posText: Each bar is a POS category. Curves connect POS tags that appear next to each other inside ayahs.
Help.ayahText: Each bar is an ayah. Curves connect ayahs through shared selected context.
Help.tipsText: Switch mode in the sidebar, use root search in Root mode, and zoom in to reveal more items.

RadialSura.title: Radial Surah Map
RadialSura.hints: Hover for preview, click to pin, drag to pan, scroll to zoom.
RadialSura.helpText: Bars represent ayahs (length = token count, color = dominant POS). Arcs connect ayahs that share roots.
RadialSura.dragPan: Drag to pan · scroll to zoom

Help.title: Radial Surah Map
Help.description: A circular map of one surah showing every ayah and root-based links between ayahs.
Help.ringsText: Each outer bar corresponds to one ayah. Longer bars indicate more tokens in that ayah.
Help.dotsText: Ayah endpoints are marked with dots; color reflects dominant part of speech.
Help.navText: Hover to inspect, click to focus, and follow root arcs to trace local thematic links.

AyahDependency.title: Ayah Dependency
AyahDependency.empty: Hover or click a token rectangle
AyahDependency.noTokens: No tokens available for {surah} in current dataset.

Help.title: Dependency Tree
Help.description: Shows the grammatical dependency structure of a single ayah.
Help.treeText: Words are arranged by dependency depth, from heads to dependents.
Help.linksText: Curves and labels show grammatical dependency relations between words.

CorpusArchitecture.title: Quran Structure Map
CorpusArchitecture.subtitle: Center -> Surahs -> Roots
CorpusArchitecture.zoomToSeeMore: Zoom in to reveal more roots
CorpusArchitecture.searchRootHint: {count} unique roots available. Search to highlight any root across surahs.
CorpusArchitecture.noRootFound: No matching root found. Try a different Arabic root.

Help.title: Quran Structure Map
Help.description: A radial hierarchy from the full corpus to surahs and their roots.
Help.hierarchyText: Center = corpus, first ring = surahs, outer ring = roots.
Help.nodesText: Node size reflects token volume (surahs) or occurrence count (roots).
Help.interactText: Click a surah to focus it. Click a root to inspect counts. Drag to pan and scroll to zoom.
Help.tipsText: After focusing a surah, zoom in to reveal more roots, or use search to highlight a root globally.

RootFlow.title: Root to Lemma Flow
RootFlow.notFound: Root '{root}' not found in {scope}. Try selecting 'All roots'.
RootFlow.helpLeftRight: Left column lists roots; right column lists lemmas.
RootFlow.helpBands: Each curved band maps one root to one lemma.
RootFlow.helpThickness: Thicker bands mean higher frequency in the current scope.
RootFlow.helpHover: Hover a band to preview a sample token; click to inspect.

Help.title: Root-Lemma Flow
Help.description: A Sankey view of how roots distribute across derived lemmas.
Help.widthText: Band thickness represents occurrence count for that root-lemma pair.
Help.leftRightText: Left side shows roots, right side shows lemmas; each band is one mapping.
Help.scopeText: Counts update with your active scope (whole corpus or selected surah).

RootNetwork.dragPan: Drag to pan - wheel to zoom
RootNetwork.noTokens: No token data loaded for this surah yet. Keep corpus loading, then retry this surah.
RootNetwork.noMorphology: Morphology data unavailable for this surah. Roots/lemmas require a full morphology dataset.

Help.title: Root Network Graph
Help.description: A force graph of root-lemma relationships in the current scope.
Help.rootsText: Larger central nodes are roots; smaller nodes are lemmas derived from them.
Help.distanceText: Shorter links usually indicate stronger or more frequent root-lemma association.
Help.sizeText: Node size reflects occurrence frequency in the selected scope.

CollocationNetwork.title: Collocation Network
CollocationNetwork.windowTypeHintAyah: Uses all words in the same ayah, highlighting broader thematic association.
CollocationNetwork.windowTypeHintDistance: Uses only nearby words around each match, highlighting local phrasing.
CollocationNetwork.noData: Select a root (from search or graph) to display collocations.
CollocationNetwork.contextWindowRefHelpAyah: This points to the ayah where the tertiary context co-occurs with the selected root.
CollocationNetwork.contextWindowRefHelpDistance: This points to the exact token position used as the center of the word-distance window.
CollocationNetwork.lemmaLayerHint: Hover or tap a collocate to reveal lemma samples.

Help.title: Collocation Network
Help.description: Maps the semantic neighborhood of a selected root using statistical co-occurrence.
Help.pmiText: PMI highlights unexpectedly strong associations, not just frequent words.
Help.graphText: Center node = selected root. Secondary nodes = collocates. Tertiary nodes = sampled context references.
Help.windowText: Use Same Ayah for broader theme-level context, or Nearby Words for phrase-level context.

Onboarding.title: Welcome to Quran Corpus Visualizer
Onboarding.subtitle: Start with one practical task, then follow a short guided walkthrough.

purpose.title: Why this platform exists
purpose.body: This project helps you explore Quranic morphology and structure visually, so roots, lemmas, and relations become easier to inspect and compare.

navigation.title: How to navigate quickly
navigation.body: Use the graph switcher to move between visualizations, search to jump to tokens or roots, and the inspector sidebar to review linguistic details.

graphs.title: How to read the graphs
graphs.body: Most views support hover for preview, click for focus, drag to pan, and wheel to zoom. Export can save the current view or the full graph.

insights.title: How to get better insights
insights.body: Apply lexical coloring modes and theme palettes to reveal patterns in frequency, identity, and structure across surahs, roots, and lemmas.

findRoot.title: Find a root
findRoot.body: Use search to find a root, then jump directly to matching words.

seeAcrossSurahs.title: See it across surahs
seeAcrossSurahs.body: Switch to distribution views to compare where that root appears most.

inspectGrammar.title: Inspect one ayah's grammar
inspectGrammar.body: Open word details to review lemma, POS, and morphology for a selected token.

welcome.title: Guided walkthrough
welcome.body: This quick tour highlights the key sections and shows how the main graph families work.

header.title: Header controls
header.body: Use language and display controls to adapt the interface while keeping your analysis context.

search.title: Global search
search.body: Search roots, lemmas, Arabic tokens, or glosses to jump directly into relevant passages.

switcher.title: Visualization switcher
switcher.body: Switch between complementary graph modes to study structure, flow, and syntax from different angles.

canvas.title: Main canvas
canvas.body: Most visualizations support hover for preview, click for focus, drag to pan, and wheel to zoom.

currentSelection.title: Current selection panel
currentSelection.body: This panel summarizes your active view, surah, ayah, root, and lemma so you can keep context while navigating.

legend.title: Legend guide
legend.body: This legend explains colors and symbols for the current graph, so you can read relationships faster and avoid misinterpretation.

mobileWelcome.title: Mobile quick tour
mobileWelcome.body: This short tour shows the fastest way to search and navigate on touch devices.

mobileSearch.title: Search first
mobileSearch.body: Use the search button in the bottom bar to find roots, lemmas, and tokens quickly.

mobileTools.title: Open tools when needed
mobileTools.body: Use the tools toggle to inspect details and switch views without losing context.

root.label: Root
root.description: Base Arabic letters a word family comes from.

lemma.label: Lemma
lemma.description: Dictionary base form of a word.

pos.label: POS
pos.description: Part of speech, such as noun, verb, or particle.

collocation.label: Collocation
collocation.description: Words or roots that frequently appear together.
